revised_title: Thermometric Barometer for Measuring Mountain Heights
tldr: The author, F. J. H. Wollaston, discusses the use of a thermometric barometer to measure the height of Snowdon and compares his results with previous trigonometrical and barometric measurements. He also mentions improvements in the construction of the instrument. The height of Snowdon, as obtained by the thermometric barometer, is 3546.25 feet.
